subject: Main Controller in Upgrade Mode
description_text:
Hi, I just received my pedals (ProX). Got them all mounted on the rig and
tried powering them up. I get an error that the main controller is in
upgrade mode. It has the latest software version.

Not sure what to do next?

Thanks
Aubrey Godwin





 [image: Simsonn Fault.png]

conversations.body_text: Hi Aubrey Cundall,  Please release the upgrade button on the control box, then reinsert the USB cable. The device will enter normal operating mode.

Manually updated firmware and now it works. Went into Iracing and throttle wouldn’t work. Now back in the app and it shows everything ok, but throttle doesn’t work. I unplugged/replugged the throttle and it still doesn’t work. The lights on the throttle are on. 


Sent from my iPhone

>

Hi Aubrey Cundall,  If the blue progress bar can reach 100% when testing the throttle in SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2, the pedal is working properly. You can then restart iRacing. iRacing has some special requirements, so you need to recalibrate in the game settings. Rest assured, iRacing is fully supported.

Simsonn manager doesn’t show the throttle working now. Brake yes, throttle no.

Sent from my iPhone

>
Hi Aubrey Cundall,  Please use the Offset function first, and then recalibrate the pedal.
